abstract: Nicholas Lemann, who guided Columbia’s journalism school as the industry was undergoing rapid changes, will step down at the end of this academic year.
snippet: Nicholas Lemann, who guided Columbia’s journalism school as the industry was undergoing rapid changes, will step down at the end of this academic year.
lead_paragraph: 9:21 p.m. | Updated Nicholas Lemann, the dean of the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism, who led the program through a turbulent decade as digital media forced sweeping changes in the industry, is stepping down at the end of the academic year. The university announced his departure on Wednesday.

headline.main: Lemann to Step Down as Dean of Journalism School at Columbia
headline.print_headline: Dean of Journalism School At Columbia Is Stepping Down
